body_content.explanation: the ability of something to produce the intended result:
examples: The study is a serious attempt to understand the efficacy of cash incentives as a way of promoting learning.

body_content.explanation: how well a particular treatment or drug works under carefully controlled scientific testing conditions:
examples: The clinical report shows results of almost 95% efficacy for the vaccine.
Of course, the efficacy of any drug in a study will be different from its actual performance in the population.
Efficacy trials determine whether an intervention produces the expected result under ideal circumstances.
